intro: Epilobium pictum, commonly known as the painted willow or velvetleaf willow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in stream banks and woodland edges. Epilobium pictum is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
